newsitem.title: USA: Clinton plays golf in 100-degree heat.
newsitem.headline: Clinton plays golf in 100-degree heat.

text.p: A day before he leaves for vacation, President Bill Clinton spent a sweltering Saturday afternoon playing golf in a Washington suburb.
Wearing a wide-brimmed straw hat, Clinton spent five hours shooting 18 holes at the private Belle Haven Country Club in Alexandria, Virginia, as temperatures topped 100 degrees.
The president was joined by two friends, Kit Ashby and Lee Williams, and by White House aide Marsha Scott.
Clinton plans to fly to Martha's Vineyard in Massachusetts on Sunday to start a three-week vacation. Aides say he'll spend the time playing more golf, reading and walking.
